reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 550/06: PRESCRIBED MATTERS - UPPER-TIER COMMUNITY IMPROVEMENT PLANS
reg_info.reg_name_text: Prescribed matters — upper-tier community improvement plans
reg_info.citation: O. Reg. 550/06: PRESCRIBED MATTERS - UPPER-TIER COMMUNITY IMPROVEMENT PLANS

content.content: 1. In this Regulation, “infrastructure” means physical structures and associated facilities that form the foundation of development, including, (a) communications systems, (b) electric power systems, oil and gas pipelines, alternative energy systems and renewable energy systems, (c) transportation corridors and facilities, (d) waste management systems, and (e) water works, wastewater works, stormwater works and associated facilities.  O. Reg. 550/06, s. 1.
content.raw_html:
1. In this Regulation,

“infrastructure” means physical structures and associated facilities that form the foundation of development, including,

(a) communications systems,

(b) electric power systems, oil and gas pipelines, alternative energy systems and renewable energy systems,

(c) transportation corridors and facilities,

(d) waste management systems, and

(e) water works, wastewater works, stormwater works and associated facilities.  O. Reg. 550/06, s. 1.

content.section: Matters that may be dealt with in upper-tier community improvement plans
content.content: 2. For the purposes of subsection 28 (4.0.1) of the Act, the community improvement plan of an upper-tier municipality may deal only with the following matters: 1. Infrastructure that is within the upper-tier municipality’s jurisdiction. 2. Land and buildings within and adjacent to existing or planned transit corridors that have the potential to provide a focus for higher density mixed-use development and redevelopment. 3. Affordable housing.  O. Reg. 550/06, s. 2.
content.raw_html:
2. For the purposes of subsection 28 (4.0.1) of the Act, the community improvement plan of an upper-tier municipality may deal only with the following matters:

1. Infrastructure that is within the upper-tier municipality’s jurisdiction.

2. Land and buildings within and adjacent to existing or planned transit corridors that have the potential to provide a focus for higher density mixed-use development and redevelopment.

3. Affordable housing.  O. Reg. 550/06, s. 2.

content.section: Matters that may be dealt with in upper-tier community improvement plans
content.content: 3. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation).  O. Reg. 550/06, s. 3.
content.raw_html: 3. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation).  O. Reg. 550/06, s. 3.

content.section: Matters that may be dealt with in upper-tier community improvement plans
